summary: No more need to self-nerf! The seriously overpowered Smithing and Enchanting skill trees are reworked. Only heavy armor hits armor-cap. Light armor comes close with max skills. Potion exploit fixed. Crafting and Tempering separated. Magic resistance on Enchanting tree. Extra Effect split into 3 perks.
descriptionHtml:
[center][color=f08020][size=3][b]This mod will continue in [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=10037]ACE - Comprehensive Enhancements[/url]
I won\'t update this page anymore, but I\'ll leave it for people who like it in it\'s current state.
The master mod linked above will off modular file support, 
so you can still find updates to this mod there.[/b][/size][/color][/center]

[center]
[color=008080][size=3][b]Athyra\'s Comprehensive Enhancements - ACE - Crafting[/b][/size][/color]

[img]http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/images/10521-2-1333129416.jpg[/img]
[color=008000][size=4][b]What this Mod does[/b][/size][/color]
[color=008080][size=3][b] Smithing[/b][/size][/color]
- Weaponsmith: Weapons can be increased to the next rank. (Affects all weapons in the game)
and, Ignore 5% damage from weapons you know how to craft.
(No other perks required to ignore 5% damage from iron/wooden weapons)
- [url=http://static.skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/images/10521-3-1331382363.jpg]Master Weaponsmith[/url]: Puts Legendary rank within reach.
- Armorsmith: Armor can be increased to the next rank. (Affects all armors in the game)
and, Ignore 5% armor when attacking enemies wearing armor you know how to craft.
(No other perks required to ignore 5% armor from leather/hide/iron armor)
- [url=http://static.skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/images/10521-2-1331382362.jpg]Master Armorsmith[/url]: Puts Legendary rank within reach.
- [url=http://static.skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/images/10521-2-1331382252.jpg]Arcane Blacksmith[/url]: requires Weaponsmith, Armorsmith and lvl 30
- The Smithing tree [url=http://static.skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/images/10521-2-1333129416.jpg]looks like an Anvil[/url]! (Really really close!) 
- Armor Effects: - after getting the perk, effect applies while wearing 3+ pieces of that type -
(all these effects show up in the Active Effects Menu, so you know they are working)
* Glass Forming: resist magic +5%
* Orcish Fabricating: stamina regenerates 10% faster.
* Dwarven Engineering: stagger 10% less.
* Dragon Smithing: take 5% less damage from any Dragon attack.
* Elven Casting: magicka regenerates 10% faster.
* Scale Crafting & Plate Crafting & Daedric Shaping 
& Ebony Molding & Steel Forging - in next version
(the \"in next version\" above have a placeholder in Active Effects, they all add a little health for now)
 
[color=008080][size=3][b] Enchanting[/b][/size][/color]
- [url=http://static.skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/images/10521-3-1329932104.jpg]Enchanter[/url]: 10% / 20% / 30%
- [url=http://static.skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/images/10521-5-1329932036.jpg]Elemental Enchanter[/url]: 10% / 20% (It combines fire, frost, and shock into one enchant)
- Insightful Enchanter: 20% at lvl 30
- Corpus Enchanter: 20% at lvl 70
- [url=http://static.skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/images/10521-5-1329931999.jpg]Magic Anticipation[/url]: 10% / 15% magic resistance
- [url=http://static.skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/images/10521-1-1329932031.jpg]Partial Duality[/url]: 2 enchants each at 66% power (these 3 \"duality\" perks expand on \"Extra Effect\"
- [url=http://static.skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/images/10521-2-1329932033.jpg]Mutual Duality[/url]: 2 enchants each at 83% power
- [url=http://static.skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/images/10521-3-1329932034.jpg]Symbiotic Duality[/url]: 2 enchants at full (100% of original) power
- Enchantments on 2-Handed weapons, Staves, and Unarmored Clothing have 2x power
- Enchantments on armored-torso-pieces & jewelry (rings/amulets) have 1.25x power
- Enchantments on armored gloves, boots, and helmets have 0.75x power
(Total Enchantment Power for armor & jewelry unchanged 1.25x *3 + 0.75x *3, vs vanilla 6x1)
- Fortify Smithing and Fortify Alchemy enchantments can only be placed on hand-slot.
As a result, those 2 enchants are 4x stronger, and ignore gloves 0.75x enchantment power.
Fortify Smithing/Alchemy with reduced values can still be looted on items in other slots.
(This should save space in the inventory, thanks Masthor for the suggestion!)

[color=008080][size=3][b] Potions[/b][/size][/color]
- Fortify Restoration / Enchanting / Smithing potions: no longer craftable, but can be found
- Crafted restore health/stamina/magicka potions restore over 5seconds, same total
(alchemy skill will increase both magnitude and duration of created potions, 
making them more effective overall than vanilla, but slower, so less spamming at high levels)
- The non-crafted Potions of ___ stamina/health/magicka had their effects split over 5 seconds.
- Fortify Marksman potions no longer affect all weapons
- Fortify One-Handed potions and enchantments now also apply to daggers
** For a more comprehensive overhaul of Alchemy and Food I recommend [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=11481]Phitts Alchemy and Food Overhaul[/url] **
(warning: if you use his, you will lose your fortify skill enchants! And make sure it loads after mine.)


[color=008000][size=4][b]New Tempering Progression[/b][/size][/color]
[color=008080][size=3][b] ACE - Crafting[/b][/size][/color]
* Best tempering with no perks = Exquisite at smithing lvl87+
* Best tempering with Armorsmith/Weaponsmith = Epic at smithing lvl100
* Best tempering with Master Armorsmith/Weaponsmith = Legendary at smithing lvl100
(the levels above get lower if Fortify Smithing enchantments are worn)

[color=008080][size=3][b] Vanilla Skyrim[/b][/size][/color]
* Best tempering with no perks = Flawless at smithing lvl100
* Best tempering with appropriate perk = Legendary at smithing lvl91
(the levels above get much lower if Fortify Smithing enchantments are worn)

Note that in Vanilla the Fortify Smithing enchantments are much larger than in ACE Crafting.

[color=008000][size=4][b]What this Mod does (more simply)[/b][/size][/color]
 - Tempering ability has been divided between weapons and armor perks
 - All weapons and all armor are now affected by these tempering perks.
 - The different armor perks only add the ability to create those items and add a slight damage bonus, they no longer add the double tempering bonuses.
 - Vanilla is easy to exploit, this mod is not.
 - Playing with this mod means you can max out the skill trees and still play a balanced game!

[color=008000][size=4][b]For Existing Characters[/b][/size][/color]
* To people adding this mod mid-game. All your perks will transfer smoothly. The weaponsmith and armorsmith perks are new though. You will have to add them. You can use the console command to replace missing perks with the new perks or to shift perk points around. (see below)
* I strongly recommend making a new set of armor after installing this mod!
* Item drops and loot can give better enchantments, it makes looting worthwhile again!
* Your old potions and gear will still have their enchants unchanged on them.

[color=008000][size=4][b]Mod Compatibility[/b][/size][/color]
Smithing Perks Overhaul (SPO) - Not necessary and not compatible. SPO adds more items to some smithing perks. My mod affects all weapons and all armors in the game, so SPO is no longer necessary if you use my mod.
Complete Crafting Overhaul (CCO) - Compatible. Furthermore, my mod removes SPO as a prerequisite to CCO. The load order is not important.
Weapons and Armor Fixes (WAF) - Compatible. The load order is not important.
other mods? - ask in the discussion thread, I will try them out!

[img]http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/images/10521-1-1333129414.jpg[/img][/center]

files.changelogHtml:
Fixed text in Master Weaponsmith (functionality was okay, just text)
Moved Glass armor effect to Elven armor, Changed Glass armor effect to 5% magic resist.
Made the restoration potion weights start at 0.1 and end at 0.5, so they sort by weight also.
The remaining armor effects still use placeholders, need more thinking time for these ><
